title: Towards Geo-Culturally Grounded LLM Generations
author: Piyawat Lertvittayakumjorn (Google), David Kinney (Washington University in St. Louis), Vinodkumar Prabhakaran (Google), Donald Martin, Jr. (Google), Sunipa Dev (Google), ...
relevance_why: The exploration of retrieval augmented generation techniques could inform audio-language models about incorporating rich cultural contexts, which is applicable to music generation tasks.
background: This study investigates methods to enhance cultural awareness in language model generations using external knowledge sources like bespoke cultural knowledge bases and web search.
contribution: The paper introduces KB-grounding and search-grounding strategies to improve LLM cultural familiarity, demonstrating varying performance impacts across detailed benchmarks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods highlighted biases in data and limited cultural representations within LLMs.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances models by employing external knowledge, showing that web-grounding outperforms knowledge base grounding in many scenarios.

key_innovation: The unique incorporation of extensive web search data allows LLMs to access up-to-date cultural information, enhancing the accuracy of generated content related to diverse cultures.
real_world_impact: Improving cultural representation in LLMs has significant implications for global applications, making AI more adaptable and useful across cultural contexts.
limitations: The reliance on web-sourced data can reinforce stereotypes, and the human evaluation showed limited improvements in generative fluency.

new_terms.retrieval augmented generation (RAG): **Retrieval augmented generation (RAG)** is a technique that combines retrieval systems with language models to allow dynamic information gathering from external sources.
new_terms.cultural fluency: **Cultural fluency** refers to the ability to communicate effectively and appropriately within various cultural contexts, integrating deep understanding beyond mere factual knowledge.
